restaurant.name: Sylvias
restaurant.description: It's famous for asdffs

restaurant.name: Red Roosters
restaurant.description: The Tower of chicken! It is enough to feed like 6 people. Also a very nice and lively place

restaurant.name: Sottocasa
restaurant.description: V good pizza compared to Princeton's Nomad pizza - like actually, the best pizza i've ever had tbh. Nice staff and v cute environment and good enough for Italian people to eat here.

restaurant.name: Sugar Monk
restaurant.description: Fantastic vibe and great drinks. I had: Ugly beauty: citrus and black licorace flavor. Very good. My favorite. Memoey of the garden: earthy tons with citrus. Lenny had: Marie laveau: burbon, pomegranate, applewood smoke. Lenny's fav.  Campfire in a drink within a french bistro. Daphne's old fashion: really good old fashioned

restaurant.name: Harlem Burger Co.
restaurant.description: They have good french fries with the garlic sauce thing

restaurant.name: Mess Hall
restaurant.description: So-so bar. Really cramped and can be loud

restaurant.name: Lido
restaurant.description: They have a great mussels dish! Food overall is good and filling. Great cocktails

restaurant.name: Bo's Bagels
restaurant.description: Used to be here once a week minimum. bagels are A+! they are made fresh! Diane was the main cashier and is very friendly. Fav bagels: Chopped Cheese, The Ashley, the Uptown Vegan

restaurant.name: Harlem Tavern
restaurant.description: nice environment,  nice burgers - their veggie burgers are super big, calamari was excellent

restaurant.name: BLVD Bistro NY
restaurant.description: Kinda pricey but good food! Few veggie options. Ran into my study abroad classmate here once in 2019.

restaurant.name: Row House
restaurant.description: good mimosas and live music - alright brunch spot. they had a nice brunch menu deal back in 2019

restaurant.name: Cafe Frederick
restaurant.description: coffee in the morning and a hookah lounge at night. not many drink options here since it is mainly for hookah.

restaurant.name: Bean & Barley
restaurant.description: pretty alright hang out spot - lots of seating! They serve coffee earlier in the day and alcohol in the afternoon

restaurant.name: Melba's
restaurant.description: I think this is the sister location to Sylvia's. They have live music throughout the summer on the street on Sundays. Their food portions are kinda small for the price. I prefer Sylvia's

restaurant.name: Bier International
restaurant.description: closed in 2019. Was a great vibe and had beers that came in pints. Lenny and I went there for Christmas 2018 and they have us free sparkling wine. Their tacos were delicious

restaurant.name: Cantina Taqueria & Tequila Bar
restaurant.description: When they first opened in 2021, we knew everyone working there and their margaritas were always very strong. But management was bad and everyone we knew left; since then we haven't been back. They attract bad vibes and we wish they'd close. Their food is also bland.

restaurant.name: RDV-Rendezvous
restaurant.description: Cute color scheme and nice wine and cocktails for $6 during happy hour! Apparently they have all you can eat mussels on Wednesday starting at 5pm. They closed in 2019 though.

restaurant.name: Root Juicery of Harlem
restaurant.description: Favorite place to get acai bowls and healthy smoothies. Owner is really nice.

restaurant.name: Cafe Amrita
restaurant.description: They serve coffee in the morning and alcohol in the afternoon/evening + food. I have only gotten a chai here since they didn't have matcha. It was alright

restaurant.name: Blue Bottle Coffee
restaurant.description: A chain. Their matcha lattes are delicious since they don't premix in sugar. They also have seasonal drinks.

restaurant.name: Tartina
restaurant.description: Pastas are pretty good. They make their casse y peppe in a cheese wheel. The seafood could be better.

restaurant.name: The Hamilton
restaurant.description: Relaxing atmosphere, nice bartender, good selection of whiskey, gin and alcohol in general. The cocktails are pretty good.

restaurant.name: 108 Dried Hot Pot
restaurant.description: Dried hot pot is super good and flavorful. Dishes are big enough for 1 person (with leftovers) so it is nice to customize your hot pot for you

restaurant.name: Absolute Bagels
restaurant.description: Jewish people tend to say this is the best bagel place in the world/in New York. It is alright though, less topping options and the bagels are a bit chewy compared to Bo's Bagels

restaurant.name: Suma Sushi
restaurant.description: very OKay sushi place. nothing special about it, but nothing bad about it either. It is honestly pretty forgettable

restaurant.name: Ellington in the Park
restaurant.description: Great place to grab a quick bite and drink by the dog park. They close during the fall - spring though until it gets hot.

restaurant.name: Mama's TOO
restaurant.description: Really good pizza, reallt bready though. Takes forever to receive if ordering take out but come there and order by slice, it doesn't take as long. The casse y peppe pizza and poached pear pizza are pretty good. Also their classic margarita is great.

restaurant.name: The Ellington
restaurant.description: cute brunch spot. their brunch drinks are good and their quinoa salad was really great.

restaurant.name: Cafe de Soleil
restaurant.description: Brunch cocktails were $6! Smoked salmon was not bad. Staff was very friendly

restaurant.name: Naruto Romen
restaurant.description: A lot better than ivan ramen. Less salty than ivan ramen and the sake was really tasty

restaurant.name: Moonrise Izakaya
restaurant.description: Opened in fall of 2020, we used to frequent here because the food was always delicious. Their management was not good though

restaurant.name: Birch Coffee
restaurant.description: A chain, coffee is not bad.

restaurant.name: Pio Pio 6
restaurant.description: A chain. Pretty good and flavorful. Loved the tuna civiche and the chicken empanadas.

restaurant.name: Jacob's Pickles
restaurant.description: the pickle back shots were pretty good, so were the baked pickles. The mac and cheese is a must but is super filling and cheesy.

restaurant.name: E's Bar
restaurant.description: Had a frozen ros√© here while waiting for seating at Jacob's Pickles. They are dog friendly

restaurant.name: Jin Ramen Upper West Side
restaurant.description: Handful of food options including ramen and rice bowls. None of the dishes are my favorite to get every time.

restaurant.name: Chalait UWS
restaurant.description: Lots of Matcha options! Had their boba matcha latte with a fruit flavor in it and was pretty good. Have been here numerous times and always get something new (it's a good thing because everything is good!).

restaurant.name: Senn Thai Comfort Food
restaurant.description: All their dishes are flavorful and delicious. One of my favorite thai spots. Their curries are all spicy and flavorful, their soft shell crab is delicious, Lenny always gets their chicken

restaurant.name: Caledonia Bar
restaurant.description: Nice, good for date or with a friend or two. Limited seating away from the bar. Cocktails were good

restaurant.name: Angaar Classic Indian Cuisine
restaurant.description: Affordable prices. Pretty good indian food. Service is a bit weird when sitting outside due to the bike lane in the middle.

restaurant.name: Lilly's Cocktail and Wine
restaurant.description: Nice aesthetic and drinks. Atmosphere is a bit crowded and loud.

restaurant.name: Zurruto
restaurant.description: they have garlic and butter edamame !!! <3 <3 the veggie miso ramen was pretty flavorful and non salty but it had kimchi in it which i feel like made the flavor a bit too much.

restaurant.name: Rosa Mexicano
restaurant.description: Really spacious restaurant with nice decorations. Food was so-so.

restaurant.name: Momofuku Noodle Bar Uptown
restaurant.description: Love the ginger ramen and mushroom ramen. Very flavorful vegatarian ramen, maybe the most flavorful veggie ramen I've ever had. Appetizers are all good and their desserts are delicious

restaurant.name: Tanoshi Sushi Sake Bar
restaurant.description: BYOB, beautiful place for omakase that is cheaper than other options. Only like 8 chairs per timeslot.

restaurant.name: Loco Coco
restaurant.description: My favorite acai bowl place in NYC! Even Lenny liked it and he hates vegetables and fruits haha

restaurant.name: Donburiya
restaurant.description: their udon soup was pretty good. there are like no veggie options though :(

restaurant.name: Quality Bistro
restaurant.description: Spicy ceasar was not spicy. Caviar was alright. Scallops and tuna tartar were pretty good.

restaurant.name: Ippudo Westside
restaurant.description: moderately flavorful vegetarian ramen  nice shrimp buns

restaurant.name: On the Rocks
restaurant.description: pricy whiskey bar, not really memorable in my opinion.

restaurant.name: Tsuru Ton Tan
restaurant.description: Giant Udon bowls! Their vegetable tempura udon bowl was pretty good. Apparently they have a daily happy hour at the bar - where they have a draft beer for $1.99

restaurant.name: Friedman's
restaurant.description: nice service and mimosas. few veggie options

restaurant.name: Doc's Oyster Bar
restaurant.description: Good starters! The brussel sprouts and cauliflower were really good. Fancy settings but some things seemed a bit dirty?
